website_summaries.verdict: If you're not a shutterbug, the Motorola Droid Razr M's sleek style, fast CPU, and great battery life make it an excellent choice.
pros: The affordable Droid Razr M features a fast processor, a lovely screen, 4G LTE, and long battery life
cons: The Razr M's camera takes unimpressive images, and its battery isn't removable

customer_reviews.title: Phone is 2G - Not 4G
customer_reviews.text: This phone is advertised as a 4G phone but when I tried to activate the phone AT&T told me that the device had been downgraded to a 2G device and it is no longer supported. So the phone will not work. I'm very disappointed and returning the device.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Rhynes

customer_reviews.title: False advertising - Phone is *NOT* unlocked
customer_reviews.text: Clearly false advertising by the vendor. This phone is *NOT* unlocked and will not work on GSM networks (AT&T and T-Mobile).
customer_reviews.author: JJH

customer_reviews.title: Faulty and Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my daughter's Christmas gift and it was having freezing issues but I didn't make a big deal. It has now been on the charging screen since this morning and it's completely frozen. This was a faulty phone obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Adina Allen

customer_reviews.title: does not a place in settings to set apn. ...
customer_reviews.text: does not a place in settings to set apn...is a 3.25 OS although on box it says 4.4, I'm without a phone fo rat least the night because I tried to transfer my service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy phone. Works great
customer_reviews.text: This phone survived several drops and getting a bit of rain on it from being at sporting events. Screen hasn't cracked, and corners are only dinged up a little. Sturdy phone. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Yarp

customer_reviews.title: Description and actual product did not match.. We ...
customer_reviews.text: Description and actual product did not match.. We had ordered for unlock phone, but what we have got is locked phone.
customer_reviews.author: Md Asif Azhar

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and time
customer_reviews.text: It would not work with AT&T too out of date... Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Experience!!!
customer_reviews.text: The phone was actually in a lot better condition than I expected. Fast shipping and everything was smooth. Repeat customer for sure whenever I'm in the market for another device.
customer_reviews.author: Craig LeFevre

customer_reviews.title: replacement phone
customer_reviews.text: I had this phone before and loved it so when my other phone broke it was my first choice. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kalcorn

customer_reviews.title: My phone isn't a phone
customer_reviews.text: I originally loved the phone but mine stopped being able to send and receive calls after a month. Hopefully it doesn't happen to you
customer_reviews.author: Alex Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This product met my full expectations and was very easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: Travis Donte Hamlett

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone is a nice little phone. Not top of the line by any means but it suits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good upgrade for me, don't need the big "bells and whistles" type just yet
customer_reviews.author: bluz

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SERVICE but so-so product
customer_reviews.text: Service was 5-star, but PRODUCT IS 3-STAR...so I'm posting 4 stars. Phone has some obnoxious features and assumes you already know how to use it. Synchronizing email lists was a disaster...opening the phone was a disaster...tagging photos a disaster...I could go on, but seriously -- who has time for this s***?
customer_reviews.author: Roland Stone

customer_reviews.title: I Love Androids
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase, phone a little slow now and then, but it will get me through the next 14 months of my Verizon contract. Updated 11/17/14- The phone turned off and would not boot up, just kept getting the Droid eye. I bought this phone because I dropped the original in water and the touchscreen was not working. I didn't want to buy a new phone so I decided to take the screen off the replacement that doesn't boot up and put it on the water damaged one. 45 Minutes later I have a working phone, I need to just make it until April 2015, or if I can find a good Black Friday deal. The purchase was still worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Falvey

customer_reviews.title: sim card
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone before given to me by a friend. it heats up really quick if you don't clear the ram, but other than it slowing down and heating up, it's a pretty good phone. I loved it. My mom destroyed it so finally a year later (now) my dad buys me the same phone again, but verizon can't even supply me a proper sim card. I now have this phone all brand new and just sitting in my drawer, and i can't even use it. Any suggestions on how to get a working sim card for it would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Motorola DROID RAZR M XT907 Factory Unlocked GSM Android Smartphone, Black
product_meta.description: 8-MP camera; full HD 1080p camcorder; front-facing video chat camera; Bluetooth stereo music; 8GB me Processor Speed: 1.5 GHz OS: Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean) Wireless-N Wi-Fi networking (with optional Wi-Fi Mobile Hotspot service)
feature_bullets: 8-MP camera; full HD 1080p camcorder; front-facing video chat camera; Bluetooth stereo music; 8GB me
Wireless-N Wi-Fi networking (with optional Wi-Fi Mobile Hotspot service)

Unlocked cell phones are compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T and T-Mobile as well as with GSM SIM cards (e.g. H20, Straight Talk, and select prepaid carriers). Unlocked cell phones will not work with CDMA Carriers like Sprint, Verizon, Boost or Virgin.
